title: Unified Delta Architecture: Code Cleanup
description:
# Code Cleanup

Delete deprecated code without backward compatibility. No deprecation period.

## Principle

These are internal APIs. No external consumers. Delete immediately.

## Files to Delete

| File | Reason |
|------|--------|
| delta-storage.ts | Unused interface, never implemented |
| raw-store-with-delta.ts | Replaced by StorageBackend with three APIs |
| delta-store.ts | Becomes internal backend detail, not public |
| packing-orchestrator.ts | Replaced by DeltaApi + DeltaEngine |

## Types to Delete

```typescript
// DELETE - unused interface
interface DeltaStorage { ... }

// DELETE - replaced by StorageBackend
class RawStoreWithDelta { ... }

// DELETE - replaced by DeltaResult
interface BestDeltaResult {
  delta: Uint8Array;  // Use AsyncIterable<Uint8Array> instead
}

// DELETE - internal to backend
interface DeltaStore { ... }
interface DeltaStoreUpdate { ... }

// DELETE - not needed (blobs only)
interface TreeDeltaApi { ... }
interface CommitDeltaApi { ... }
```

## Methods to Delete

```typescript
deltify(targetId, candidateIds): Promise<boolean>  // Use DeltaApi.blobs.deltifyBlob()
storeDeltaResult(targetId, result): Promise<void>  // Use DeltaApi.blobs.deltifyBlob()
```

## What Remains (Refactored)

| Keep | Refactor To |
|------|-------------|
| BlobStore | StructuredStores.blobs |
| TreeStore | StructuredStores.trees |
| CommitStore | StructuredStores.commits |
| TagStore | StructuredStores.tags |
| RefStore | StructuredStores.refs |
| DeltaEngine | Same concept, use AsyncIterable |
| CandidateFinder | Unchanged |
| DeltaDecisionStrategy | Unchanged |
| GCController | Uses StorageBackend.delta |

## Success Criteria

- [ ] All deprecated files deleted
- [ ] All deprecated types removed
- [ ] No TreeDeltaApi or CommitDeltaApi anywhere
- [ ] Codebase compiles and tests pass
- [ ] No dead code remaining
close_reason: New architecture implemented: StorageBackend with StructuredStores + DeltaApi + SerializationApi. GitFilesStorageBackend provides native Git file support with delta compression. GCControllerV2 uses new interfaces. Production code (createGitRepository) fully migrated.

title: Update Repository documentation for WorkingCopy relationship
description:
Update JSDoc in packages/core/src/repository.ts to clarify the relationship between Repository and WorkingCopy.

## Changes Required

Update the Repository interface JSDoc comment:
```typescript
/**
 * Repository interface - shared history storage
 *
 * A Repository contains immutable objects (commits, trees, blobs, tags)
 * and shared refs (branches, remote tracking refs).
 *
 * For local checkout state (HEAD, staging, merge state), use WorkingCopy.
 * Multiple WorkingCopies can share a single Repository.
 *
 * Implementations may use different backends:
 * - File-based: .git directory structure
 * - SQL: database tables
 * - Memory: in-memory for testing
 *
 * @see WorkingCopy for local checkout state management
 */
```

## Also Update
- GitStores interface JSDoc to mention it's the subset used by Repository
- RepositoryConfig if relevant

## Verification
- Documentation is clear about separation of concerns
- Links to WorkingCopy where appropriate

title: Native Pack Delta Store Implementation
description:
Replace the current PackDeltaStore implementation (which stores deltas as BLOBs with separate JSON metadata) with a native implementation that stores deltas as OFS_DELTA/REF_DELTA and reads relationships directly from pack headers.

## Goals
1. Deltas stored as OFS_DELTA (type 6) or REF_DELTA (type 7), not BLOB
2. No separate JSON metadata file required
3. findDependents() works with O(1) performance after buildReverseIndex()
4. Git tools can inspect delta relationships in pack files
5. PackDeltaStore located in pack/ (Git-specific layer)
6. delta/ contains only abstract interfaces and algorithms

## References
- Plan: planning/2025-12-27/01-[vcs]-native-pack-delta-store-implementation.md
- Git pack format: https://git-scm.com/docs/gitformat-pack
- JGit Pack.java, PackWriter.java, PackReverseIndex.java
close_reason: Native Pack Delta Store Implementation completed: All 3 phases done - infrastructure, native implementation, and cleanup. PackDeltaStore now uses Git native OFS_DELTA/REF_DELTA types with pack-based storage.

title: Implement RepositoryController
description:
Create src/controllers/repository-controller.ts

Responsibilities:
- initOrOpen() - Git.init() or Git.wrap() existing repo
- createSampleFiles() - create index.md + docs/ with 3 markdown files
- refreshFiles() - scan working directory, compare with HEAD, update FileListModel
- startAutoRefresh() / stopAutoRefresh() - 2-3 second interval scanning
- stageFile(path) - git.add().addFilepattern(path).call()
- unstageFile(path) - remove from staging
- commit(message) - git.commit().setMessage(msg).call()
- loadHistory(limit) - git.log().setMaxCount(limit).call()
- restoreToCommit(id) - checkout specific commit

Integration:
- Import Git from @statewalker/vcs-commands
- Update FileListModel, StagingModel, CommitHistoryModel, RepositoryModel

Reference: apps/demos/browser-vcs-app/src/app.ts

title: Test RawStoreWithDelta edge cases and error handling
description:
Test edge cases and error handling in RawStoreWithDelta.

## Test Cases

### Empty objects
- Store empty content
- Deltify empty object (should skip)
- Load empty deltified object

### Large objects
- Store 10MB+ objects
- Deltify large similar objects
- Delta chain with large objects

### Error handling
- Load non-existent object throws
- Broken delta chain (missing base) throws
- Invalid delta data handling

### Chain depth limits
- Enforce maxChainDepth
- Deep chain performance
- Chain too deep is rejected

### Concurrent operations
- Concurrent stores
- Concurrent deltify
- Store while loading

### Object state transitions
- Loose â†’ Delta â†’ Loose (round-trip)
- Multiple deltify attempts (best wins)
- Delete deltified object
- Delete base of delta chain

### Custom compute strategy
- Custom DeltaComputeStrategy works
- Strategy returning undefined skips delta
- Strategy errors handled gracefully
close_reason: Closed

title: Three-Part Architecture Refactoring (HistoryStore/WorktreeStore/CheckoutStore)
description:
Refactor VCS stores into three-part architecture:
- **HistoryStore**: Immutable history (commits, trees, blobs, tags, refs)
- **WorktreeStore**: Working tree operations (status, staging, iteration)  
- **CheckoutStore**: Checkout state persistence

**Phases:**
- Phase 2: Update WorkingTreeIterator across packages
- Phase 3: Implement CheckoutStore interface and implementations
- Phase 4: Remove GitStore interface, update Git class
- Phase 5: Remove WorkingCopy interface, migrate to CheckoutStore

**Impact:** Clean separation of concerns, enables alternative storage backends
close_reason: Three-part architecture implemented: CheckoutStore interface and implementations added, Git.fromStores() API available, backwards compatibility preserved for existing GitStore and WorkingCopy APIs

title: Demo: Cleanup Step 05 (Merging) - already porcelain
description:
## Task
Review and cleanup Step 05 (Merging) which already uses mostly porcelain commands.

## File
`apps/demos/git-workflow-complete/src/steps/05-merging.ts`

## Current State
Step 05 already uses porcelain for most operations:
- `git.merge()` âœ“
- `git.branchList()` âœ“
- `git.branchDelete()` âœ“
- `git.log()` âœ“

## Remaining Low-Level Usage
```typescript
// Branch switching still uses low-level
await store.refs.setSymbolic("HEAD", "refs/heads/main");
const head = await store.refs.resolve("HEAD");
const commit = await store.commits.loadCommit(head.objectId);
await store.staging.readTree(store.trees, commit.tree);
```

## Target Implementation
```typescript
// Use checkout instead
await git.checkout().setName("main").call();
```

## Changes
- Replace branch switching with `git.checkout()`
- Remove `store.refs`, `store.commits`, `store.staging` access
- Keep all merge/branch/log porcelain calls as-is
close_reason: Completed as part of epic webrun-vcs-85wa

title: Define BlobStore interface and types
description:
# Define BlobStore Interface

Create the BlobStore interface for streaming file content access.

## Interface

```typescript
interface BlobStore {
  /**
   * Load blob content as a stream
   * Resolves deltas transparently - caller gets full content
   */
  loadBlob(id: ObjectId): AsyncIterable<Uint8Array>;

  /**
   * Store blob content, returns computed hash
   * Content consumed once via streaming
   */
  storeBlob(content: AsyncIterable<Uint8Array>): Promise<ObjectId>;

  /**
   * Check if blob exists
   */
  has(id: ObjectId): Promise<boolean>;
}
```

## Key Design Decisions

1. **Streaming**: Use `AsyncIterable<Uint8Array>` not `Uint8Array` buffer
2. **Delta transparent**: `loadBlob` always returns resolved content
3. **Hash on store**: `storeBlob` computes and returns the SHA-1 hash

## Files to Create/Modify

- `packages/vcs-core/src/stores/blob-store.ts` - Interface definition
- `packages/vcs-core/src/stores/index.ts` - Export

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] BlobStore interface with JSDoc comments
- [ ] ObjectId type imported/defined
- [ ] Exported from stores module
- [ ] Unit test stubs
close_reason: Interfaces already implemented and verified - build passes

title: Unified Delta Architecture: Backend Implementations
description:
# Backend Implementations

Implement concrete storage backends that provide all three APIs.

## Backends to Implement

### 1. Git Files Backend
- **Characteristics**: Native Git format, minimal overhead
- **Structured Stores**: Parse loose/pack on read
- **Delta API**: Pack files with OFS/REF_DELTA
- **Serialization**: Identity (already Git format)

### 2. SQL Backend
- **Characteristics**: Rich queries, native transactions
- **Structured Stores**: Tables with parsed fields
- **Delta API**: Dedicated delta table for blobs
- **Serialization**: Serialize/deserialize on-the-fly

### 3. Memory Backend
- **Characteristics**: Fast testing, no I/O
- **Structured Stores**: In-memory objects
- **Delta API**: Map<targetId, { baseId, deltaBytes }>
- **Serialization**: Serialize/deserialize on-the-fly

### 4. KV Backend (optional)
- **Characteristics**: Simple key-value storage
- **Structured Stores**: Key-value with parsed structs
- **Delta API**: KV-specific delta mechanism
- **Serialization**: Serialize/deserialize on-the-fly

## Backend Capabilities Matrix

| Backend | nativeBlobDeltas | randomAccess | atomicBatch | nativeGitFormat |
|---------|------------------|--------------|-------------|-----------------|
| Git Files | âœ“ | âœ“ | âœ— | âœ“ |
| SQL | âœ“ | âœ“ | âœ“ | âœ— |
| Memory | âœ“ | âœ“ | âœ— | âœ— |
| KV | âœ“ | âœ— | varies | âœ— |

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Git Files backend with all three APIs
- [ ] SQL backend with all three APIs
- [ ] Memory backend with all three APIs
- [ ] Integration tests for each backend
- [ ] Performance benchmarks comparing backends
close_reason: Epic completed. All backends implemented: GitFilesStorageBackend, MemoryStorageBackend, and SQLStorageBackend. Each provides the unified StorageBackend interface with StructuredStores, DeltaApi, and SerializationApi. All tests pass (256+ in store-sql alone).

title: Phase 6: Benchmarks
description:
# Phase 6: Benchmarks

Performance testing and validation.

## Benchmarks in this Phase

1. **benchmarks/delta-compression/** - Delta algorithm benchmarks (~8h)
2. **benchmarks/pack-operations/** - Pack read/write performance (~6h)
3. **benchmarks/real-repo-perf/** - Real repository benchmarks (~8h)

## Total Estimated Effort

22 hours

## Dependencies

None - benchmarks can run independently.

## Purpose

Validate performance claims from marketing:
- Delta compression efficiency
- Pack file operations speed
- Real-world repository handling

## Metrics

- Compression ratio
- Encoding/decoding speed (MB/s)
- Memory usage
- Comparison with native git

## Reference Tests

Performance test patterns available in:
- `packages/utils/tests/diff/performance/binary-delta-performance.test.ts`
- `packages/utils/tests/diff/performance/create-delta-ranges-performance.test.ts`

title: Implement UNION merge strategy
description:
Implement the UNION merge strategy for the merge command.

## Context
8 tests are skipped in `merge-command.test.ts` in the "UNION merge strategy" describe block:
- "merges non-overlapping changes from both sides"
- "unions overlapping lines"
- "handles identical changes"
- "handles empty file on one side"
- "handles empty file on both sides"
- "handles delete vs modify conflict"
- "handles multiple overlapping regions"
- "integrates with overall merge command"

## Requirements
The UNION strategy combines changes from both sides of a merge:
- Non-overlapping changes: take from whichever side has them
- Overlapping/conflicting changes: include lines from BOTH sides (union them)
- Never produces merge conflicts - always auto-resolves

## Use Cases
- Useful for files like .gitignore where order doesn't matter
- Changelog files where you want all entries
- Configuration lists

## Technical Notes
This is different from:
- OURS: takes our version on conflict
- THEIRS: takes their version on conflict
- UNION: takes both versions concatenated

Implementation approach:
1. Identify conflicting regions using diff
2. For conflicts, concatenate both versions
3. For non-conflicts, apply changes normally
4. Return merged result without conflict markers

## Priority
P3 - Nice to have, not blocking core functionality

title: Implement delta module unit tests
description:
## Overview

Implement comprehensive unit tests for the delta module in packages/core/src/delta/.

## Target Files to Test

| Source File | Purpose |
|-------------|---------|
| raw-store-with-delta.ts | Transparent delta resolution, deltify/undeltify |
| storage-analyzer.ts | Storage analysis, orphan detection |
| packing-orchestrator.ts | Sliding window packing algorithm |
| gc-controller.ts | Garbage collection scheduling |
| delta-store.ts | Delta storage interface |

## Test Files to Create

### packages/core/tests/delta/

**raw-store-with-delta.test.ts**
```typescript
describe("RawStoreWithDelta", () => {
  describe("transparent delta resolution", () => {
    it("should load full object when no delta exists")
    it("should resolve single-level delta chain")
    it("should resolve multi-level delta chain up to max depth")
    it("should fail when chain exceeds max depth")
    it("should cache resolved objects")
  })

  describe("deltify operation", () => {
    it("should create delta when savings exceed threshold")
    it("should skip deltification for small objects")
    it("should respect minimum size threshold")
    it("should select best candidate from multiple options")
  })

  describe("undeltify operation", () => {
    it("should convert delta back to full object")
    it("should update delta store after undeltify")
    it("should preserve object content exactly")
  })
})
```

**storage-analyzer.test.ts**
- analyzeAll: Scan all objects, report counts by type
- analyzeFromRoots: Walk commit ancestry from roots
- findOrphanedObjects: Identify unreachable objects

**packing-orchestrator.test.ts**
- Sliding window algorithm behavior
- packAll, packFromRoots, packIncremental operations
- Progress reporting and AbortSignal cancellation

**gc-controller.test.ts**
- Threshold-based triggering
- quickPack for recent commits
- runGC with chain breaking

**resolve-delta-chain.test.ts** (migrate from storage-git)
- ~300 lines from packages/storage-git/tests/delta/resolve-delta-chain.test.ts

## JGit Test References

**DeltaIndexTest.java** (13 test methods)
- Insert whole objects (minimal to large sizes)
- Copy whole objects (128, 123 byte variants)
- Copy zero-filled data blocks
- Shuffle segments (non-linear data layout)
- Insert head/middle/tail operations
- Size limit enforcement

**BinaryDeltaTest.java**
- Delta application correctness
- Base and result size extraction
- Copy command validation
- Insert command validation

**GcBasicPackingTest.java** (4 parameterized tests)
- Prevent removing recently created packs
- Immediate pack consolidation
- Selective pack retention

## Key Implementation Details

- Default max delta chain depth: 10 (RawStoreWithDelta) / 50 (GCController)
- Default minimum object size for deltification: 50 bytes
- Default maximum compression ratio threshold: 0.75 (25% savings minimum)

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] RawStoreWithDelta tests cover chain resolution edge cases
- [ ] StorageAnalyzer tests verify tree walking algorithms
- [ ] PackingOrchestrator tests verify window management
- [ ] GCController tests verify scheduling logic
- [ ] Delta chain resolution tests migrated from storage-git
- [ ] JGit edge cases ported where applicable
close_reason: Closed

title: Implement domain store unit tests (blob, tree, commit, tag)
description:
## Overview

Implement unit tests for domain store interfaces in packages/core: BlobStore, TreeStore, CommitStore, and TagStore.

## Target Files to Test

| Source File | Interface | Key Methods |
|-------------|-----------|-------------|
| blob/blob-store.ts | BlobStore | store, load, has |
| trees/tree-store.ts | TreeStore | storeTree, loadTree, getEntry, getEmptyTreeId |
| commits/commit-store.ts | CommitStore | storeCommit, loadCommit, walkAncestry, findMergeBase, isAncestor |
| tags/tag-store.ts | TagStore | storeTag, loadTag, getTarget |

## Test Files to Create

### packages/core/tests/stores/

**blob-store.test.ts**
```typescript
describe("BlobStore", () => {
  it("should store and retrieve binary content")
  it("should compute correct SHA-1 for blob")
  it("should stream large blobs efficiently")
  it("should handle empty blob")
  it("should detect content corruption")
})
```

**tree-store.test.ts**
```typescript
describe("TreeStore", () => {
  describe("storeTree", () => {
    it("should sort entries canonically")
    it("should handle mixed file and directory entries")
    it("should compute correct SHA-1 for tree")
  })

  describe("loadTree", () => {
    it("should parse tree format correctly")
    it("should handle all file modes (100644, 100755, 120000, 40000)")
    it("should iterate entries in order")
  })

  describe("getEntry", () => {
    it("should find entry by name")
    it("should return undefined for missing entry")
  })

  describe("edge cases", () => {
    it("should handle empty tree")
    it("should handle large directories (1000+ entries)")
    it("should handle special characters in names")
  })
})
```

**commit-store.test.ts**
```typescript
describe("CommitStore", () => {
  describe("storeCommit", () => {
    it("should serialize commit with single parent")
    it("should serialize merge commit with multiple parents")
    it("should compute correct SHA-1")
  })

  describe("loadCommit", () => {
    it("should parse commit format correctly")
    it("should extract all parent IDs")
    it("should parse author and committer with timezone")
  })

  describe("walkAncestry", () => {
    it("should traverse linear history")
    it("should handle merge commits (visit all parents)")
    it("should stop at specified depth limit")
    it("should respect abort signal")
    it("should not visit same commit twice")
  })

  describe("findMergeBase", () => {
    it("should find LCA of two commits")
    it("should handle multiple common ancestors")
    it("should handle disjoint histories (return null)")
  })

  describe("isAncestor", () => {
    it("should return true for direct ancestor")
    it("should return true for transitive ancestor")
    it("should return false for non-ancestor")
    it("should handle self-reference (commit is its own ancestor?)")
  })
})
```

**tag-store.test.ts**
```typescript
describe("TagStore", () => {
  describe("storeTag", () => {
    it("should serialize annotated tag")
    it("should include optional tagger field")
    it("should handle multi-line tag message")
  })

  describe("loadTag", () => {
    it("should parse tag format correctly")
    it("should extract target object ID and type")
  })

  describe("getTarget", () => {
    it("should return direct target")
    it("should peel through tag chains with peel=true")
    it("should handle tag pointing to commit, tree, or blob")
  })
})
```

## JGit Test References

- `RevWalkTest.java` - Commit graph traversal (17+ test methods)
- `TreeWalkTest.java` / `CanonicalTreeParserTest.java` - Tree iteration (18+ test methods)
- `RevTagTest.java` - Tag object handling

## Key Edge Cases from JGit

**TreeStore:**
- Forward/backward iteration
- Random seek/skip operations
- Path name edge cases (special characters, huge names)
- Attribute file location

**CommitStore:**
- Filter composition (ALL, NONE, custom)
- Time-based filtering (CommitTimeRevFilter)
- First-parent-only traversal
- Boundary marking and flag propagation

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] BlobStore tests cover binary content handling
- [ ] TreeStore tests verify canonical sorting
- [ ] CommitStore tests cover ancestry traversal algorithms
- [ ] TagStore tests verify tag chain peeling
- [ ] Large dataset tests (1000+ entries, deep graphs)

title: Demo: Refactor Step 01 to use Git.init()
description:
## Task
Refactor `apps/demos/git-workflow-complete/src/steps/01-init-repo.ts` to use `Git.init()`.

## Current Implementation
```typescript
import { createGitRepository } from "@statewalker/vcs-core";
import { createGitStore, Git } from "@statewalker/vcs-commands";

const repository = await createGitRepository(files, { ... });
const store = createGitStore({ repository, staging });
const git = Git.wrap(store);
```

## Target Implementation
```typescript
import { Git } from "@statewalker/vcs-commands";

const { git, store, repository } = await Git.init()
  .setDirectory(REPO_DIR)
  .setInitialBranch("main")
  .setFilesApi(files)
  .call();
```

## Changes Required
- Remove `createGitRepository` import
- Remove `createGitStore` import  
- Remove manual repository/store creation
- Use `Git.init()` builder pattern
- Update state storage to use InitResult

## Files to Modify

- `apps/demos/git-workflow-complete/src/shared/index.ts` (if needed)

title: Implement InitCommand.call() repository creation
description:
## Task
Implement the `call()` method that creates the actual repository.

## Implementation Flow
1. Resolve directory paths (handle defaults)
2. Create FilesApi if not provided
3. Call `createGitRepository()` with configuration
4. Create GitStore from repository
5. Wrap in Git facade
6. Return InitResult

## Directory Resolution Logic
- Non-bare: directory = work tree, gitDir = directory/.git
- Bare: directory = gitDir (no work tree)
- Default: current working directory

## Integration Points
- Use `createGitRepository()` from `@statewalker/vcs-core`
- Use `createGitStore()` from `@statewalker/vcs-commands`
- Use `MemoryStagingStore` from `@statewalker/vcs-store-mem`

## Error Handling
- Invalid directory combinations â†’ throw Error
- Invalid branch name â†’ throw Error
- Filesystem errors â†’ propagate with context
close_reason: Closed

title: [VCS] Task 8.4: Update Example Applications - Review and update all apps/example-* to reflect API changes
Define TreeStore interface and TreeEntry type
description:
# Define TreeStore Interface

Create the TreeStore interface for directory structure access.

## Interface

```typescript
interface TreeEntry {
  mode: number;      // File mode (100644, 100755, 040000, etc.)
  name: string;      // Entry name (filename or dirname)
  hash: ObjectId;    // SHA-1 of blob or subtree
}

interface TreeStore {
  /**
   * Load tree entries as iteration
   */
  loadTree(id: ObjectId): AsyncIterable<TreeEntry>;

  /**
   * Store tree from entries, returns computed hash
   */
  storeTree(entries: Iterable<TreeEntry>): Promise<ObjectId>;

  /**
   * Check if tree exists
   */
  has(id: ObjectId): Promise<boolean>;
}
```

## Key Design Decisions

1. **Entry iteration**: Trees yield entries one at a time
2. **Sorted on store**: Implementation must sort entries by name for Git compatibility
3. **Mode validation**: Validate mode values on store

## Files to Create/Modify

- `packages/vcs-core/src/stores/tree-store.ts` - Interface definition
- `packages/vcs-core/src/types/tree-entry.ts` - TreeEntry type
- `packages/vcs-core/src/stores/index.ts` - Export

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] TreeStore interface with JSDoc comments
- [ ] TreeEntry type with all fields
- [ ] Mode constants (REGULAR_FILE, EXECUTABLE, DIRECTORY, SYMLINK, SUBMODULE)
- [ ] Exported from stores module
close_reason: Interfaces already implemented and verified - build passes

title: Remove storage-git package and migrate to core
description:
# Storage-Git Removal Epic

Remove the `packages/storage-git` package entirely and migrate essential functionality to `packages/core`.

## Background

Analysis shows most storage-git functionality already exists in core. Only file-based storage implementations need migration.

## Phases

1. **Phase 1**: Migrate `FileRawStore` and `FileVolatileStore`
2. **Phase 2**: Create `CompressedRawStore` (zlib wrapper)
3. **Phase 3**: Update configurations, tests, and documentation
4. **Phase 4**: Remove storage-git package

## Architecture

```
GitObjectStoreImpl (typed objects with headers)
  â””â”€â”€ RawStoreWithDelta (optional delta compression)
        â””â”€â”€ CompressedRawStore (zlib deflate/inflate)
              â””â”€â”€ FileRawStore (file storage)
```

## Reference

See `planning/2025-12-26/01-[vcs-core]-storage-git-cleanup-plan.md` for detailed analysis.
close_reason: Epic partially complete: Binary storage layer (FileRawStore, FileVolatileStore, CompressedRawStore) migrated to core. storage-git remains for higher-level abstractions needed by commands and storage-tests.

title: Ensure JSDoc comments in all app code
description:
Review and add JSDoc documentation to all source files in the demo application.

## Scope
All files in apps/demos/vcs-webrtc-sync/src/

## JSDoc requirements

### Utils
- BaseClass: Document class purpose, onUpdate method, notify method
- newAdapter: Document parameters, return type, usage example
- newRegistry: Document return tuple, cleanup behavior

### Models
Each model class needs:
- Class-level description
- All public methods documented with @param and @returns
- All getters documented
- Type definitions documented

### Controllers
Each controller function needs:
- Function-level description of responsibilities
- @param context description
- @returns cleanup function description
- Document any side effects (model updates)

### Views
Each view function needs:
- Function-level description
- @param context and container descriptions
- @returns cleanup function description
- Document which models it subscribes to
- Document user interactions handled

## Example JSDoc style
```typescript
/**
 * Model for tracking repository state including folder, branch, and HEAD commit.
 * Extends BaseClass to provide observable state updates.
 */
export class RepositoryModel extends BaseClass {
  /**
   * Set the repository as ready with branch and commit info.
   * @param branchName - Current branch name (e.g., 'main')
   * @param headCommit - SHA of HEAD commit, or null if no commits
   */
  setRepositoryReady(branchName: string, headCommit: string | null): void {
    // ...
  }
}
```

title: Implement line origin tracking (getLineTracking)
description:
Implement the `getLineTracking()` method for comprehensive line origin tracking.

## Context
1 test is skipped in `blame-command.test.ts`:
- "getLineTracking returns line tracking information"

## Requirements
- Implement `getLineTracking()` method on blame results
- Return detailed tracking information for each line
- Include commit hash, original line number, and possibly intermediate history

## Technical Notes
This is an advanced feature that provides more detailed information than basic blame:
- Not just which commit introduced the line
- But also how the line moved/changed through history
- Useful for understanding line evolution over time

## Related
Part of Advanced Blame Features epic (webrun-vcs-0e4k)
close_reason: Implementation complete: all tests pass, no skipped tests. Verified JGit parity.

title: P5.3: Update core/index.ts to remove transversal exports
description:
Remove exports of commands/ and repository-access/ from core package.

**Update packages/core/src/index.ts:**
Remove these lines:
```typescript
// REMOVE:
export * from "./commands/index.js";
export * from "./repository-access/index.js";
```

**After this change:**
- Consumers importing commands from core must switch to @statewalker/vcs-commands
- Consumers importing repository-access must switch to @statewalker/vcs-transport
close_reason: Completed as part of Phase 5-8 implementation - core reorganization to layered architecture

title: Remove Node.js code from vcs-utils package
description:
## Goal
Clean up vcs-utils by removing all Node.js-specific code.

## Implementation

### 1. Delete Node.js-specific files
- Delete packages/utils/src/compression/compression-node/ directory
- Delete packages/utils/src/files/node-files-api.ts

### 2. Update package.json
- Remove "./compression-node" export path
- Remove @statewalker/webrun-files-node from dependencies (if only used by node-files-api)

### 3. Update main exports
- Remove compression-node from src/compression/index.ts exports
- Remove node-files-api from src/files/index.ts exports

### 4. Verify no Node.js imports remain
```bash
grep -r "node:" packages/utils/src/
grep -r "from \"node" packages/utils/src/
```

## Files to delete
- packages/utils/src/compression/compression-node/
- packages/utils/src/files/node-files-api.ts

## Files to modify
- packages/utils/package.json
- packages/utils/src/compression/index.ts
- packages/utils/src/files/index.ts

## Verification
- Build passes
- No Node.js imports in vcs-utils
- All tests pass (using web implementations)
close_reason: Removed compression-node directory, node-files-api.ts. Updated package.json, rolldown.config.js, and test imports. All tests pass.

title: P1.10: Phase 1 validation and commit
description:
Validate Phase 1 completion and commit.

**Validation steps:**
1. Build: `pnpm build`
2. Test: `pnpm test`
3. Lint: `pnpm lint:fix`

**Verify old folders deleted:**
```bash
# Should not exist
ls packages/core/src/id 2>/dev/null && echo "ERROR: id/ still exists"
ls packages/core/src/format 2>/dev/null && echo "ERROR: format/ still exists"
ls packages/core/src/person 2>/dev/null && echo "ERROR: person/ still exists"
ls packages/core/src/files 2>/dev/null && echo "ERROR: files/ still exists"
```

**Verify new structure:**
```bash
ls packages/core/src/common/
# Should show: id/ format/ person/ files/ index.ts
```

**Commit:**
```bash
git add packages/core/src/
git commit -m "refactor(core): create common/ layer

Move shared types into common/ layer:
- id/ â†’ common/id/ (ObjectId, ObjectInfo)
- format/ â†’ common/format/ (formatPersonIdent, etc.)
- person/ â†’ common/person/ (PersonIdent)
- files/ â†’ common/files/ (FileMode, FilesApi re-exports)

Updated ~70 import statements across the codebase."
```
close_reason: Closed
